text:
Paul Shrubb (1 August 1955 – 28 May 2020) was an English professional footballer, coach and scout. He made 350 appearances as a player in the Football League. He played for Brentford and Aldershot.
He later returned to Aldershot as assistant manager and coached at a number of non-league clubs.
Shrubb was diagnosed with motor neurone disease in January 2006 and was given two years to live by doctors. He died from the disease on 28 May 2020, aged 64.
